item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, September 16, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Launch HN: Silurian (YC S24) – Simulate the Earth (91 points | 58 comments)
2. Product management is hosting a party, not playing chess (34 points | 17 comments)
3. Datomic and Content Addressable Techniques (9 points | discuss)
4. Stephen Fry – AI: A Means to an End or a Means to Our End? (45 points | 3 comments)
5. How to Succeed in Mr Beast Production (Leaked PDF) (1663 points | 1058 comments)
6. Fair: A Go library for serving resources fairly (117 points | 18 comments)
7. Fractran: Computer architecture based on the multiplication of fractions (38 points | 6 comments)
8. Show HN: Sisi – Semantic Image Search CLI tool, locally without third party APIs (50 points | 20 comments)
9. D&D is Anti-Medieval (132 points | 173 comments)
10. Show HN: JAQT – JavaScript Queries and Transformations (51 points | 15 comments)
11. Attacking PowerShell Clixml Deserialization (29 points | 6 comments)
12. Speech Dictation Mode for Emacs (92 points | 25 comments)
13. Nothing: Simply Do Nothing (268 points | 115 comments)
14. g1: Using Llama-3.1 70B on Groq to create o1-like reasoning chains (269 points | 110 comments)
15. The First HTML LSP That Reports Syntax Errors (184 points | 53 comments)
16. Plain Text Accounting (PTA) (241 points | 84 comments)
17. The HTTP Query Method (56 points | 29 comments)
18. The Analyst and the Bard (3 points | discuss)
19. How to Lead Your Team When the House Is on Fire (316 points | 164 comments)
20. Ask HN: Does anyone use sound effects in their dev environment? (85 points | 130 comments)
21. The Waterfall Model was a straw man argument from the beginning (2015) (61 points | 85 comments)
22. Paraguay Loves Mickey, the Cartoon Mouse. Disney Doesn't (146 points | 71 comments)
23. Bitcoin puzzle #66 was solved: 6.6 BTC (~$400k) withdrawn (380 points | 316 comments)
24. Oracle, it's time to free JavaScript (25 points | 2 comments)
25. “Golden Lettuce” is genetically engineered to have higher beta-carotene levels (14 points | 14 comments)
26. CSSnano (90 points | 29 comments)
27. Braiding the spaghetti: implementing defer in the preprocessor (29 points | 11 comments)
28. I give you feedback on your blog post draft but you don't send it to me (2021) (177 points | 59 comments)
29. Earth may have had a ring system 466 million years ago (24 points | 10 comments)
30. Tell HN: DanBC has died (429 points | 68 comments)
